author: Times-News
title: Halloween Happenings calendar for Oct. 11, 2015
text: Posted Oct. 11, 2015 at 12:01 AM By Times-News Posted Oct. 11, 2015 at 12:01 AM Editor’s note: Halloween Happenings is for haunted/entertainment events only in Alamance County, the Piedmont-Triad and throughout the state of North Carolina. It will be published now through Halloween in the Accent section, as space allows. For more details or to submit events, email capple@thetimesnews.com or call (336) 506-3057. Haunted forest hayride, beginning at dark on Friday and Saturday nights through month of October, J. Razz Ma Tazz Farm, 466 Peeden Drive, Gibsonville. $12 for haunted forest. www.jrazz.com . 26th annual Original Hollywood Horror Show, 6333 Bass Mountain Road, Snow Camp. Hours are 8 p.m. to 11 p.m. Sundays through Thursdays and 8 p.m. to midnight Fridays and Saturdays. Dates are today and Oct. 15-31. $20. www.hollywoodhorrorshow.com or visit them on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram. Scarowinds, 14523 Carowinds Blvd, Charlotte. Hours are 7 p.m. to midnight today and Oct. 16-18, 23, 25 and Oct. 30 and 7 p.m. to 1 a.m. Oct. 24 and 31. Tickets range from $33.99 and up. www.carowinds.com/haunt or visit them on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram. Zombie Scarefest, 6 p.m. to 11 p.m. today through Oct. 31, former Western Electric Plant, 204 N. Graham-Hopedale Road, Burlington. $20. zombiescaref est.com/ , www.facebook.com/zombiescarefest or (410) 533-1604 Woods of Terror, 5601 N. Church St., Greensboro. today and Tuesday and Oct. 15-18, 22-25 and 29-31 and Nov. 1, 6 and 7. Gates open at 6 p.m., ticket booth opens at 6:30 p.m. and show starts at 7 p.m. Ticket booth closes at 9:30 p.m. Sundays through Thursday; 11:30 p.m. Fridays and Saturdays and Nov. 1, 6 and 7. $18 and up. woodsofterror.com or (336) 286-9396. Tweetsie Railroad® Ghost Train, 7:30 p.m. Friday and Saturday nights only, Friday and Saturday and Oct. 23-24 and 30-31, Tweetsie Railroad, 300 Tweetsie Railroad Lane, Blowing Rock. $34 per person and free for children 2 and under. A limited number of guests are admitted nightly. Tweetsie.com or (800) 526-5740. Haunted Forest Reborn, 153 Darrell Davis Road, Burlington. Hours are 7:30 p.m. to 11 p.m. Friday and Saturday and Oct. 23-24 and 30-31. Cash only; $12 for adults and $5 for children 6 to 10 years old. www.rdellinger.freeservers.com or (336) 266-5109. 43rd annual Hawfields Civitan Haunted Forest, 2115-B Hwy. 119 South, Mebane. Hours are 7:30 p.m. to 11 p.m. on Friday nights and 7 p.m. to 11 p.m. on Halloween night. The event will close at 10 p.m. Oct. 29. Dates are Friday and Saturday and Oct. 23-24, 29-31. $10. An annual fundraiser for the international award-winning Hawfields Civitan Club and Hawfields Junior Civitan Club. www.hchauntedforest.com . Page 2 of 3 - Haunted Theater, Liberty Showcase Theater, 101 S. Fayetteville St., Liberty. Dates are Friday and Saturday, Oct. 23-24, 28-29 and 31. Call (336) 622-3844 for advance tickets and information. A-O Civitans’ Halloween Hoot On The Farm, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. Saturday, Therrel & Marie Brown’s home, 6236 Hwy. 87 North, Caswell County. Event for autistic children and their families. Hay rides, horseback riding, moonwalk, slide, live bands, trampoline and more. RSVP by Thursday at (336) 585-0908 or aoc.funon thefarm@gmail.com. Rain date is Oct. 24. Hawfields Civitan’s No Scare, 2 p.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 24 and 31, 2115-B Hwy. 119 South, Mebane. For ages up to 12 years old. $2. A fundraiser for the Hawfields Civitan Club and Hawfields Junior Civitan Club. www.hchauntedforest.com Halloween Egg Scramble, 6 p.m. Oct. 22 on the Moricle Park ballfields. Children 10 and under can search for 3,000 candy- and toy-filled eggs. Prizes awarded in each age group, including a prize for best costume. Presented by the Gibsonville Parks & Recreation Department. Rain date is 6 p.m. Oct. 29. (336) 449-7241. Haunted Train, City Park, 1333 Overbrook Road, Burlington. A Halloween twist on the train ride; this year’s event is Oct. 29-31. The train will leave the station at 6:30 p.m. each night. $5. This is a fundraiser for Alamance Arts and is in conjunction with the Burlington Recreation & Parks Department. (336) 226-4495. House of Spirits, 7 p.m. to 10 p.m. Oct. 29, 7 p.m. to midnight Oct. 30 and 7 p.m.-until Oct. 31, Freedom Fellowship Church, 522 Trollinger St., Burlington. (336) 261-9801 or (336) 222-1778. High Point Community Theatre presents “The Addams Family,” 7:30 p.m. Oct. 29-30, 10 p.m. Oct. 31 and 2 p.m. Nov. 1, High Point Theatre, 220 E. Commerce Ave., High Point. $38 and up. www.highpointtheatre.com or (336) 887-3001. Downtown Halloween Spooktacular, 3 p.m. to 5 p.m. Oct. 30 in downtown Burlington. Costume parade throughout downtown Burlington at 3 p.m., trick-or-treating and live entertainment. (336) 222-5030 or btowneventsnc.com or visit Btown Events on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Halloween Movies On The Lawn, Slade Park, 404 Ball Park Ave., Elon. “Monsters, Inc.” begins at 6:30 p.m. Oct. 30. Free. (336) 449-9255. “Murder at the Masquerade,” a murder-mystery dinner, Oct. 30, The Cutting Board, 2699 Ramada Road, Burlington. Doors open at 6:30 p.m. and the show begins at 7 p.m. Buffet dinner and cash bar available. $50 for individuals and $375 for a table of eight. (336) 229-2770. Dark In The Park Halloween Celebration, City Park, 1333 Overbrook Road, Burlington. This year’s event is from 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. Oct. 31. Halloween-themed games and the annual fireworks show at 8 p.m. (336) 222-5030 or btowneventsnc.com or visit Btown Events on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Page 3 of 3 - Clover Court Chaos, 7 p.m. to 9 p.m. Oct. 31, 518 Clover Court in the Brassfield Meadows subdivision, Burlington. Located off Lakeside/Old Glencoe Road. Free. ktg99@triad.rr.com. By Times-News
